title: TAREK09
author: TAREK09
content: Binance, Dollarpesa exchange already approved? please tell me

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: I think, no.I didn't find much reference from this service. How did you find it?Some suspicious things like new social media accounts, and trustpilot and blogger reviews that are created only this year while the service is claimed to have been established since 2016.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: It's a scam. Everything about them is shadyFor example, they say thisQuoteDollarpesa is a digital currency exchange platform. It was founded in 2016 by Mohammed Yousuf Syed. The company is based in United Kingdom, Italy, Malaysia, Dubai, United Arab Emirates.Dollarpesa provides a secure and convenient way to buy and sell cryptocurrencies.But archive show it was a completely different company back then, based in Kenyahttps://web.archive.org/web/20170707125048/http://dollarpesa.com/They are also probably lying about partnerships with Binance

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: But looking at OP's post history, it indicates they are with dollarpesa, see:Quote from: TAREK09 on August 20, 2023, 06:08:18 PMWe are at your service with many other transactions ContactTelegram: https://telegram.me/dollarpesa So what is the catch here? subtle advertisement? it's pretty obvious, everyone will say no to the question... -- assuming I interpreted the question right since it's poorly constructed.In any case, they do appear to be shady as pointed out above.

comments.author: alterra57
comments.body: Quote from: Potato Chips on August 24, 2023, 08:48:21 PMBut looking at OP's post history, it indicates they are with dollarpesa, see:Quote from: TAREK09 on August 20, 2023, 06:08:18 PMWe are at your service with many other transactions ContactTelegram: https://telegram.me/dollarpesa So what is the catch here? subtle advertisement? it's pretty obvious, everyone will say no to the question... -- assuming I interpreted the question right since it's poorly constructed.In any case, they do appear to be shady as pointed out above.He was probably waiting for someone to say: "Oh really? Binance is working with this unknown exchange??? Let me put 100k in it."

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Not only that, the OP has put his referral link to the megastock service, which when clicked opens the TurkMoney service page:At the end of a topic, he put a Telegram channel: dollarpesaQuote from: TAREK09 on August 20, 2023, 06:08:18 PMWe have been conducting authorized ecurrency exchange transactions since 2012. All of our transactions are carried out with API systems given to authorized merchants. We are also registered as a merchant on the webmoney megastock list. https://megastock.com/Resource.aspx?id=318036 our exchange services Webmoney WMZ to Bank Transfer TRY.......We are at your service with many other transactions Contact Telegram: https://telegram.me/dollarpesa I think he uses multi-level propaganda, he did all this the same day he signed up for the forum.I think this is SEO spam that needs to be reported.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: Potato Chips on August 24, 2023, 08:48:21 PMSo what is the catch here? subtle advertisement? it's pretty obvious, everyone will say no to the question... -- assuming I interpreted the question right since it's poorly constructed.In any case, they do appear to be shady as pointed out above.It is not the first platform that I have noticed. Some platforms do this, whether they are paid directly or through referral links or a third party.This approach is clear from beginners, so I do not advise anyone to trust any positive reviews, especially from beginners. Look for negative reviews and try to make sure they are accurate.Bitget exchange spammer is a good example

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: alterra57 on August 25, 2023, 07:09:27 PMHe was probably waiting for someone to say: "Oh really? Binance is working with this unknown exchange??? Let me put 100k in it."He's not going to get one and he just exposed himself as someone employing deceitful advertising, he's so ignorant that members can check his post history because we have seen this method so many times employed here. I've seen newbies spamming Bitcointalk with AI-generated articles with their links inside and this one is another method they employed not knowing that they will be easily busted.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on August 29, 2023, 12:57:00 PMQuote from: Potato Chips on August 24, 2023, 08:48:21 PMSo what is the catch here? subtle advertisement? it's pretty obvious, everyone will say no to the question... -- assuming I interpreted the question right since it's poorly constructed.In any case, they do appear to be shady as pointed out above.It is not the first platform that I have noticed. Some platforms do this, whether they are paid directly or through referral links or a third party.This approach is clear from beginners, so I do not advise anyone to trust any positive reviews, especially from beginners. Look for negative reviews and try to make sure they are accurate.Bitget exchange spammer is a good examplePretty much every platform with no budget for actual promotion is doing it in a backdoor way like in bitcointalk spamming their platform name on multiple threads so they can create a buzz and the same goes through social media where you can see someone claims "Ohh, hey I am using this platform which is very good and trusted blah blah, so as you said don't trust the blatant one-word positive reviews like "Excellent", "Very Good" which is an obvious sign of farming positive reviews.My Input is don't try risking your own money on any new thing, give it some time and you will know if it's legit then start using it.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: OP registered on the same day when he has posted two threads and didn't come back. That speaks well for what you're up to OP and that means that you're with dollarpesa and you're not legitimately asking if they're approved or whatnot. But you seem to have a successful attempt to make people curious and look on the topic that you've made but not to the actual link or channel that you've mentioned over your thread. Maybe a few or some of us did but not most of us.
